intro: Colladonia macedonica, commonly known as the Macedonian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
